page.title: 03HISTORY ON BISHOPSTONE DOWN
page.content: ALTHOUGH SO SPARSELY POPULATED NOW THERE ARE SIGNS THAT PROVE THAT MAN HAS LIVED IN THESE PARTS FROM ANCIENT TIMES.THERE ARE SEVERAL TUMULI SU252812,SU274816,SU278824,AN OLD DITCH SU273811,AND BARROWS SU273809 AS WELL AS ALFREDS CASTLE,SU278823,AND THE OLD STRIP LYNCHETTS,SU244825. THERE IS ALSO A MOSAIC PAVEMENT,ONCE PART OF A ROMAN VILLA, NOW BENEATH PLOUGHED LAND SU259815. {ALFREDS CASTLE. IRON AGE CAMP SITUATED AT SU278823 REPUTED TO HAVE BEEN OCCUPIED BY ALFRED THE GREAT WHEN HE DEFEATED THE DANES AT THE BATTLE OF ASHDOWN IN 871 AD.IT IS A TYPICAL IRON AGE BANK AND DITCH CASTLE NOW ROUGH GRASSLAND WHERE BEEF CATTLE ROAM.IT BORDERS ON THE WOODLAND OF ASHDOWN.
